intro: [WRONG START] Embilia tropophylla, commonly known as the tropical embelia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Embelia tropophylla is often used in traditional medicine for its purported antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory properties.
